verses.verse: {A Prayer for God to Intervene} d {This v. is 63:19 in the MT} If only you would tear open the heavens and {So 1QIsa a ; MT lacks and} come down, so that the mountains would quake at your presence

{This v. is 64:1 in the MT} just as fire sets twigs {Or brushwood} ablaze and the fire causes water to boil to make known your name to your enemies, yes, to your enemies before you, {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads to make your name known to your adversaries} so that the nations might quake at your presence!
When you did awesome deeds that we expected, {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads did not expect} you came down, and the mountains shuddered before you.

Since {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads And since} ancient times no one has heard, and {So 1QIsa a ; MT lacks and} no ear has perceived, and {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks and} no eye has seen any God besides you, who acts on behalf of those who wait for him.
You come to the aid of those who gladly do what's right, To those who remember you in your ways. See, you were angry, and we sinned against them for a long time, but we will be saved.

All of us have become like one who is unclean, and {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa b LXX; MT lacks and} all our righteous acts are like a filthy rag; we all shrivel up like a leaf, and like the wind, our iniquities {The 1QIsa a utilizes a masculine noun; 1QIsa b MT utilize a feminine noun} sweep us away.

There is no one who calls on your name or rouses himself to take hold of you; for you have hidden your face from us, and have given us {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads have melted us ; LXX reads have delivered us} into the control {Lit. hand} of our iniquity.

{God, our Father, will Act} d But as for you, {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read But now} O Lord , you are our Father; and {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks and} we are clay, {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read the clay} and you are our potter; we are all the work of your hands. {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads your hand}
Don't be angry beyond measure, Lord , and don't remember our iniquity for a season. {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads for ever} Please look now, we are all your people.
Your holy cities have become a desert; Zion has become like {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT lack like} a desert, Jerusalem a desolation.

Our holy Temple and our splendor, where our ancestors praised you, have become {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read Our holy and glorious Temple has become} a conflagration of fire, and all our dearest places have become {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads all our dearest places has become ; MT mss read our every dearest place has become} ruins.
Lord , after all this, can you hold yourself back? Can you keep silent and punish us so severely?
